title: Ticket #1904: qedit JobLeaseDuration doesn't work on running jobs.
description:
If you change JobLeaseDuration on a running job, the execute side never learns about the update and continues respecting the old JobLeaseDuration.

  • If a user wants to extend leases to cover a scheduled outage, he's out of luck for running jobs.
  • If the submit side ends up with a longer JobLeaseDuration, the job may remain "running" long after the execute side has abandoned it.
  • If the submit side ends up with a shorter JobLeaseDuration, the submit side may return a job to idle and restart it while the execute side keeps running it, violating Condor's promise of only running a job once.

Expected behavior: when I qedit the JobLeaseDuration for a job, the execute side should learn about it reasonably promptly.

This functionality will help #1903.
